text.0: from near or far away may mighty indra giver of succour come for our protection.
text.1: lord of men armed with thunder with the strongest slaying his foes in conflict in the battles.
text.2: may indra come to us with tawny coursers inclined to us to favour and enrich us.
text.3: may maghavan loudvoiced and wielding thunder stand by us at this sacrifice in combat.
text.4: thou honouring this our sacrifice o indra shalt give us strength and fill us full of courage.
text.5: to win the booty thunderarmed like hunters may we with thee subdue in fight our foemen.
text.6: loving us well benevolent close beside us drink godlike indra of the wellpressed soma.
text.7: drink of the meath we offer and delight thee with food that cometh from the mountain ridges.
text.8: him who is sung aloud by recent sages like a ripefruited tree a scythearmed victor.
text.9: i like a bridegroom thinking of his consort call hither indra him invoked of many.
text.10: him who in native strength is like a mountain the lofty indra born or old for conquest.
text.11: terrific wielder of the ancient thunder filled full with splendour as a jar with water.
text.12: whom from of old there is not one to hinder none to curtail the riches of his bounty.
text.13: pouring forth freely o thou strong and mighty vouchsafe us riches god invoked of many.
text.14: of wealth and homes of men thou art the ruler and opener of the stable of the cattle.
text.15: helper of men winner of spoil in combats thou leadest to an ample heap of riches.
text.16: by what great might is he renowned as strongest wherewith the lofty one stirs up wild battles.
text.17: best soother of the worshippers great sorrow he gives possessions to the man who lauds him.
text.18: slay us not bring bestow onus the ample gift which thou hast to give to him who offers.
text.19: at this new gift with this laud sung before thee extolling thee we indra will declare it.
text.20: now indra lauded glorified with praises let power swell high like rivers for the singer.
text.21: a new hymn lord of bays for thee is fashioned may we carborn through song be victors ever.
